intro: Funtumia scheffleri, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a tropical plant native to Central and Southern Africa. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 20 meters tall, characterized by its smooth, grey bark and large, palmate leaves. The plant produces striking orange-red flowers during the dry season, which are followed by elongated, woody pods containing seeds. Its rapid growth rate and ability to thrive in various soil types make it a popular ornamental and reforestation species.
